ERC20InsufficientAllowance(address,uint2.details: Indicates a failure with the `spender`’s `allowance`. Used in transfers.

params.allowance: Amount of tokens a `spender` is allowed to operate with.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

ERC20InsufficientBalance(address,uint256.details: Indicates an error related to the current `balance` of a `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.balance: Current balance for the interacting account.
params.needed: Minimum amount required to perform a transfer.
params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidApprover(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `approver` of a token to be approved. Used in approvals.

ERC20InvalidReceiver(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `receiver`. Used in transfers.

params.receiver: Address to which tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the token `sender`. Used in transfers.

params.sender: Address whose tokens are being transferred.

ERC20InvalidSpender(address).details: Indicates a failure with the `spender` to be approved. Used in approvals.

params.spender: Address that may be allowed to operate on tokens without being their owner.

OwnableInvalidOwner(address).details: The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)

OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address).details: The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.

Approval(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set by a call to {approve}. `value` is the new allowance.

Transfer(address,address,uint256).details: Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`). Note that `value` may be zero.

addTripsForMinting(address).details: function used to speed up the test of the minting processDELETE THIS FUNCTION BEFORE DEPLOYMENT ON MAINNET

params.from: address of target user on which test is performed

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._driverAddress: address of the driver of the trip

params.initialSupply: the amount of initial supply sent to the owner of the contract

params._addressesOfParticipants: a list of addresses of the passengers of the trip
params._numberOfParticipants: number of passengers of the trip
params._requiredPayment: cost of the trip per passenger
params._unsaltedIdentifier: the unsalted id of the trip

returns._0: 0 is the number of decimals admitted

params._tripIdentifier: salted identifier of the trip to close

returns._0: ongoingTrips list of ongoing trips by target user

params.driver_address: address of the driver of the trip

returns._0: bool true if successful, false otherwise

params.to: address where to send minted tokens

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

returns._0: completedTrips list of completed trips by target user

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Emits an {Approval} event indicating the updated allowance. This is not required by the EIP. See the note at the beginning of {ERC20}. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

returns._0: unmintedTripsNumber number of unminted trips by target user

params.newValue: new amount of tokens given as a reward
new amount of trips to complete

devdoc.title: Main contract to implement RGRS ERC20 token

providedTravelIdHash(bytes32).notice: Event triggered when createNewTrip terminates to share the return value

completedTrips(address,uint256).notice: Creates a relation between address and closed trips created by it

confirmTripParticipation(address,bytes32.notice: Confirms the partecipation of a passenger to a trip and performs the payment in tokens

constructor.notice: Deploy the ERC20 RGRS token with an initial supply sent to the owner of the contractSets the value of variables mintedTokens and tripsBeforeMinting

decimals().notice: Overrides the default amount of decimals defined by ERC20.sol

getOngoingTripsByAddress(address).notice: Getter function of ongoing trips of an address

hasEveryOnePaid(address,bytes32).notice: Verifies that every passenger has confirmed the participation

mintTokensByTrips().notice: Mint reward tokens when counter is sufficent

mintedTokens().notice: Number of tokens minted to drivers

ongoingTrips(address,uint256).notice: Creates a relation between address and trips created by it

retrieveConcludedTripsFromAddress(addres.notice: Getter function of concluded trips of an address

terminate().notice: Owner can destroy the contract withdrawing its balance

transferBalance().notice: Contract's owner can withdraw Eth from contract's entire balance

tripsBeforeMinting().notice: Cap of trips to complete before reward

unmintedTripsNumber(address).notice: Creates a relation between address and the number of unminted trips done by it, used to assign rewards

unmintedTripsOf(address).notice: Getter function for number of unminted trips of an address

updateMintingAmount(uint256).notice: Owner can adapt the reward amount

updateMintingTripsNumber(uint256).notice: Owner can adapt the number of necessary trips to complete before a reward can be retrieved
